definitions: Move or cause to move in a specified direction.
Go past or across; leave behind or on one side.
Change from one state or condition to another.
Succeed in an examination or test.
Transfer something to someone, especially by handing it over or letting it move through an opening.
Be approved by a parliament or committee.
examples: He watched the cars pass by.
The ball passed through the hoop.
The law passed with a majority vote.
How do you pass the time?
